result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M Marking was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Sex offender registry required during the length of probation. Sex Offender treatment as recommended by PO Agent. State offers these exceptions: immediate family members permitted to stay overnight at def's residence. bow hunting permitted at the agent's discretion and no computer access for illegal purposes but agent can search the computer at any time. No computer access for illegal purposes includes: any appliance used to search the internet. I.E. smartphone, IPhones, laptops, tablets.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy M Marking
